Description: Absolutely nothing wrong with this guitar. It was taken to luthier a few months ago to have a basic setup done and verify there were no structural issues, and it has had no repairs. Classic arch-top hollow body used by essentially every jazz guitarist. Guitar was purchased from private dealer in NYC. According to the seller the guitar was made in 1985. Very few of these guitars come to market. http://www.borysguitars.com/about/ : "By 1991, Borys Guitars were played by Joe Pass, Jimmy Wyble, Emily Remler, Larry Coryell, Larry Koonse, Pat Kelley. Later players such as Paul Bollenback, Smokey Hormel, Vic Juris and Tony D’Caprio. Currently there are 425 Borys Guitars." This is an opportunity for the serious player to own one of these very limited boutique guitars. Includes a hardshell case. See all photos for condition. Local delivery/pick up possible in DC/Philadelphia area.On Nov-01-18 at 11:34:39 PDT, seller added the following information: The guitar has been kept and stored in its case in a smoke- and pet-free home. On Nov-05-18 at 10:49:23 PST, seller added the following information: Additional information about the guitar: - Flame maple neck - Bound ebony fretboard - 12" Radius - Mother of Pearl inlays - Ebony bridge and pick guard - Schaller tuners - Kent Armstrong pickup - 20 frets - Scale length 24.75" - Bone nut (1.75" width) On Nov-09-18 at 09:18:54 PST, seller added the following information: I added one photo that I took just today of the guitar outside to give a better idea of the color and fade. It was taken today, an overcast day.
Title: Borys B-120 Archtop Hollow-Body Guitar
